title: Grevenbroich
text:
Grevenbroich () is a town in the <a href="Rhein-Kreis%20Neuss">Rhein-Kreis Neuss</a>, in <a href="North%20Rhine-Westphalia">North Rhine-Westphalia</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>. It is situated on the river <a href="Erft">Erft</a>, approximately 15 km southwest of <a href="Neuss">Neuss</a> and 15 km southeast of <a href="M%C3%B6nchengladbach">Mönchengladbach</a>. <a href="Cologne">Cologne</a> and <a href="D%C3%BCsseldorf">Düsseldorf</a> are in a 30 km reach. It is notable for having the <a href="Frimmersdorf%20Power%20Station">Frimmersdorf Power Station</a>, which was one of Europe's <a href="List%20of%20least%20carbon%20efficient%20power%20stations">least carbon-efficient power stations</a>.
